description: Code smell detection involves identifying potential issues in code that may indicate deeper problems, such as maintainability or readability concerns. These issues can lead to technical debt if not addressed, impacting the overall quality of the software.
you_have_this_if: You notice frequent bugs or issues in the codebase.
The codebase has grown significantly in size and complexity.
Developers express difficulty in understanding or modifying the code.
Code reviews frequently highlight similar issues across different modules.
Refactoring efforts have not led to significant improvements in code quality.

approaches.best_for: when you need to identify and refactor code smells in a large codebase using machine learning techniques.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While effective in detecting complex patterns, it may require substantial training data and computational resources.

decision_matrix.best_when: You have a large dataset of code and want to leverage machine learning for automated detection of code smells.

start_here: Start with the Random Forest, JRip technique as it provides a robust method for detecting code smells in large codebases, especially if you have access to sufficient training data.
